intro: Pycnocycla occidentalis, commonly known as the western pycnocycla, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has adapted to arid environments through its deep root system. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, producing a distinctive, fragrant aroma. The species is noted for its resilience and is often found in desert and chaparral ecosystems.
